quote: Hope is a good thing, maybe the best of things.
triviaQuestion: Which real prison was used for Shawshank’s exterior/interiors?
funFact: The oak tree featured in Red’s final monologue became a real-life tourist landmark in Ohio.

quote: Why so serious?
triviaQuestion: Which 70mm-format camera style helped define its IMAX sequences?
funFact: The hospital demolition was a real building implosion captured in a single take.

quote: May the Force be with you.
triviaQuestion: Which London-area studio hosted principal photography in 1976?
funFact: Luke’s surname was originally written as “Starkiller” in early drafts.

quote: Life finds a way.
triviaQuestion: What sound combo famously created the T. rex roar?
funFact: The iconic water-ripple on the cup was made by plucking a guitar string attached under the dashboard.

quote: I'm king of the world!
triviaQuestion: Which ocean-set tank facility was built for the production?
funFact: Huge near–full-scale ship sets were constructed, including a 90% exterior of the starboard side.

quote: Just keep swimming.
triviaQuestion: What species is Dory in the film’s taxonomy?
funFact: Ellen DeGeneres improvised many of Dory’s most memorable lines.

quote: I'm gonna make him an offer he can't refuse.
triviaQuestion: Which cinematographer’s ‘chiaroscuro’ lighting defines its look?
funFact: The cat on Vito Corleone’s lap in the opening scene was a stray found on set.

quote: You have to see the matrix for yourself.
triviaQuestion: Which camera technique popularized its ‘bullet time’ effect?
funFact: The Matrix’s signature green code was inspired by characters from a sushi cookbook.

quote: There's no place like home.
triviaQuestion: What material were the original ruby slippers sequins made from?
funFact: In the original L. Frank Baum novel, Dorothy’s shoes were silver—changed to ruby for Technicolor pop.

quote: To infinity and beyond!
triviaQuestion: Which company distributed Pixar’s first feature release?
funFact: It was the first fully computer-animated feature film in history.

quote: It’s not who I am underneath, but what I do that defines me.
triviaQuestion: What Tibetan-sounding location hides the League’s mountain base?
funFact: The Tumbler Batmobile was a drivable vehicle that could perform real jumps.

quote: Carpe diem. Seize the day, boys.
triviaQuestion: In-universe, at which fictional academy is it set?
funFact: Filming took place at St. Andrew’s School in Delaware, standing in for Welton Academy.

quote: Our lives are defined by opportunities, even the ones we miss.
movie: The Curious Case of Benjamin Button
triviaQuestion: Which author’s short story inspired the film?
funFact: Groundbreaking facial-aging VFX were developed to portray Brad Pitt across decades.

quote: After all, tomorrow is another day!
triviaQuestion: Which color process defined its original release prints?
funFact: Hattie McDaniel won an Academy Award for her performance—the first Oscar for a Black actor.

quote: Do, or do not. There is no try.
movie: Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back
triviaQuestion: What is the name of the swamp planet where Yoda lives?
funFact: The famous twist was kept secret; alternate script pages were used to avoid leaks.

quote: It’s supposed to be hard. If it wasn’t hard, everyone would do it. The hard is what makes it great.
triviaQuestion: Which real league is dramatized in the film?
funFact: Real AAGPBL players make cameo appearances in the closing credits game.

quote: Keep moving forward.
triviaQuestion: Whose motto inspired the film’s recurring line?
funFact: The film closes with an on-screen quote from Walt Disney: “Keep Moving Forward.”

quote: What we do in life echoes in eternity.
triviaQuestion: Which Roman emperor is a central antagonist?
funFact: Russell Crowe’s “Are you not entertained?” line was partly improvised on set.

quote: To see the world, things dangerous to come to, to see behind walls, to draw closer, to find each other, and to feel.
movie: The Secret Life of Walter Mitty
triviaQuestion: Which magazine is Mitty’s employer in the film?
funFact: Many of the film’s sweeping landscapes were shot on location in Iceland.

quote: It is not our abilities that show what we truly are… it is our choices.
movie: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
triviaQuestion: Who was Hogwarts headmaster during this story?
funFact: The production used dozens of custom-wand props; cast members reportedly went through many during filming.

quote: Why do we fall? So we can learn to pick ourselves up.
triviaQuestion: What is the name of the crime-ridden Gotham area?
funFact: Christian Bale’s distinct Batman voice became a defining—and heavily parodied—take on the character.

quote: Never give up, never surrender!
triviaQuestion: What is the alien race that recruits the cast?
funFact: A 2013 poll of Star Trek fans famously crowned it one of the best ‘Star Trek’ movies despite being a parody.

quote: There is no secret ingredient.
triviaQuestion: What is the name of the coveted martial arts scroll?
funFact: Jack Black popularized the catchphrase “Skadoosh,” which became tied to the franchise.

quote: Sometimes it is the people no one imagines anything of who do the things that no one can imagine.
triviaQuestion: Which machine’s name became synonymous with German encryption?
funFact: Production recreated Bletchley Park’s huts with meticulous period detail.

quote: Just because someone stumbles and loses their path, doesn’t mean they’re lost forever.
triviaQuestion: What are the mutant-hunting robots in this timeline?
funFact: The Quicksilver kitchen scene used ultra–high-speed photography to freeze practical elements.

quote: You mustn’t be afraid to dream a little bigger, darling.
triviaQuestion: What device enables synchronized shared dreaming?
funFact: A rotating hallway set was built to achieve the zero-gravity fight with minimal CGI.

quote: All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given to us.
movie: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
triviaQuestion: Name the Elven realm where the Fellowship meets Galadriel.
funFact: Weta Workshop built massive ‘bigatures’—miniatures so large they filled entire rooms.

quote: Adventure is out there!
triviaQuestion: What is the name of the South American tepui destination?
funFact: Paradise Falls was inspired by Venezuela’s Angel Falls and the surrounding tepui mesas.

quote: The flower that blooms in adversity is the most rare and beautiful of all.
triviaQuestion: Which dynasty setting loosely frames the film’s period?
funFact: Ming-Na Wen voiced Mulan, with Lea Salonga providing the character’s singing voice.

quote: You control your destiny—you don’t need magic to do it.
triviaQuestion: Which Scottish kingdom is Merida the princess of?
funFact: Merida is Pixar’s first female lead protagonist.

quote: Get busy living, or get busy dying.
triviaQuestion: What is the name of the rock hammer’s brand Red procures?
funFact: The film’s popularity exploded on cable and home video, later topping many ‘greatest films’ lists.

quote: It’s not about how hard you hit. It’s about how hard you can get hit and keep moving forward.
triviaQuestion: Which real network’s show hosts the film’s simulated fight?
funFact: Stallone returned to the role after 16 years, training intensely to fight in the ring again at 60.

quote: Just because something works doesn’t mean it can’t be improved.
triviaQuestion: What is the fictional metal powering Wakanda’s tech?
funFact: Costumes blended Afro-futurist design with real African textiles and 3D-printed details.

quote: Sometimes the right path is not the easiest one.
triviaQuestion: Which song won the film’s Best Original Song Oscar?
funFact: The film released the same weekend as ‘Toy Story’s’ early production push—Disney had two teams competing.

quote: The only limit is your soul.
triviaQuestion: Which Paris restaurant critic is central to the climax?
funFact: Chef Thomas Keller consulted; Remy’s signature dish was inspired by his ‘confit byaldi.’

quote: Fear is the mind-killer.
triviaQuestion: To which Great House does Paul belong?
funFact: Desert exteriors were filmed in Jordan and Abu Dhabi to capture Arrakis’ scale.

quote: There’s some good in this world, and it’s worth fighting for.
movie: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
triviaQuestion: Name the fortress where the climactic siege takes place.
funFact: Gollum became a landmark in performance capture, blending Andy Serkis’s acting with advanced VFX.

quote: You are who you choose to be.
triviaQuestion: Which Cold War year is the film set in?
funFact: Based on Ted Hughes’ book; Brad Bird wove in 1950s sci-fi and Superman homage.

quote: With great power comes great responsibility.
triviaQuestion: Which New York bridge hosts the key Green Goblin showdown?
funFact: The upside-down rain kiss was notoriously difficult to film for Tobey Maguire.

quote: Everything is possible, even the impossible.
triviaQuestion: What is the term for the lamplighters in the film?
funFact: Dick Van Dyke performed a dancing cameo at age 92.

quote: A million dollars isn’t cool. You know what’s cool? A billion dollars.
triviaQuestion: Who composed the film’s Oscar-winning score?
funFact: Most Harvard scenes were shot at Johns Hopkins and other campuses after Harvard denied permission.

quote: Not quite my tempo.
triviaQuestion: Which instrument does Andrew practice obsessively?
funFact: The feature expanded from Damien Chazelle’s 18-minute short made to attract financing.

quote: Mankind was born on Earth. It was never meant to die here.
triviaQuestion: Which theoretical physicist advised on the film’s black hole visuals?
funFact: Simulations produced by the VFX team led to academic insights about gravitational lensing.

quote: Seize your moment.
triviaQuestion: What is the name of the Day of the Dead land Miguel visits?
funFact: The film’s research trips across Mexico influenced its music, architecture, and alebrije designs.

quote: You got a dream, you gotta protect it.
triviaQuestion: Which real entrepreneur is Will Smith portraying?
funFact: The real Chris Gardner makes a cameo at the end, passing Will Smith on the street.

quote: Remember who you are.
triviaQuestion: What is the name of Simba’s homeland?
funFact: The wildebeest stampede combined hand-drawn elements with pioneering crowd simulation.

quote: Once you’ve met someone, you never really forget them.
triviaQuestion: Which studio produced this Academy Award–winning film?
funFact: It became the first (and for years only) non-English animated film to win the Best Animated Feature Oscar.

quote: I never look back, darling. It distracts from the now.
triviaQuestion: Which fashion-obsessed character says “No capes!”?
funFact: Edna Mode’s voice is by director Brad Bird himself.

quote: One step at a time. One punch at a time. One round at a time.
triviaQuestion: Who plays Adonis Creed?
funFact: Fight scenes used long takes to heighten realism, including a notable two-round single-shot bout.

quote: I’m going to have to science the shit out of this.
triviaQuestion: Which space agency is central to the rescue effort?
funFact: NASA advised on mission details; the production filmed Martian landscapes in Wadi Rum, Jordan.
